author: Zoom TV Digital
title: Medical Assessment To Hydration Strategies: 6 Ways Diabetics Can Maintain Good Health During Ramadan, Health & Fitness News | Zoom TV
text: Medical Assessment To Hydration Strategies: 6 Ways Diabetics Can Maintain Good Health During Ramadan The Holy month of Ramadan requires all Muslims all over the world to observe fasts for long hours, which may prove dangerous for diabetic patients. However, here are a few ways diabetic people can maintain health during Ramadan. The Holy month of Ramadan requires all Muslims all over the world to observe fasts for long hours, which may prove dangerous for diabetic patients. However, here are a few ways diabetic people can maintain health during Ramadan. The sacred period of Ramadan is extremely important to Muslims all over the world. The occasion is marked by fasting, prayer, and introspection. During the fast, which is kept from dawn to sunset, Muslims must abstain from food and beverages. Diabetic people who intend to observe the fast should be cautious to effectively manage their health. Here are some ways diabetic people can maintain health during Ramadan. Pre-Ramadan Medical assessment and planningBefore Ramadan, diabetic people must first undergo a medical evaluation. This evaluation should consider the type and duration of their diabetes, the medications they are currently taking and any existing complications or coexisting health conditions. Early preparation and dosage adjustments for medications are paramount. Healthcare professionals can suggest a fasting strategy that is tailored specifically to the health needs of each patient. Related News Awareness about self-monitoring and managementTeaching diabetic people about the significance of self-monitoring is fundamental to ensuring a safe fasting experience. Consistent monitoring of blood glucose levels enables patients to promptly address any notable fluctuations. Being aware of the signs and symptoms of hypoglycaemia and hyperglycaemia and being able to know when it is necessary to break the fast are crucial to avoid adverse. ALSO READ: [Sidhu Moosewala's Mom Welcomes Son At 58: A Look At Challenges Faced By Elder Women Conceiving Via IVF](https://www.zoomtventertainment.com/lifestyle/health-fitness/sidhu-moosewalas-mom-welcomes-son-at-58-a-look-at-challenges-faced-by-elder-women-conceiving-via-ivf-article-108730074) Awareness on Self-Monitoring and ManagementDuring Ramadan, maintaining a balanced diet is crucial, especially during Sahari (pre-dawn meal) and Iftar (breaking the fast). Complex carbohydrates like whole grains, vegetables and lentils should be included in the Sahari meal so that there is a slow release of energy throughout the day. Iftar should begin by having water and dates, followed by a nutritious meal including proteins, healthy fats, and complex carbohydrates. This approach helps replenish energy stores and ensures nutritional equilibrium. Adjusting medications and treatment regimesDuring Ramadan, adjustments to the timing and type of antidiabetic medications may be necessary to mitigate the risk of hypoglycaemia and hyperglycaemia. Medicines like Metformin can be beneficial due to their slow reduction in glucose levels and can reduce the risk of getting hypoglycaemia. Insulins and other medications might need changes in the dosages and timings. It is advisable to have these adjustments seen by a healthcare professional before beginning the fasting period. Hydration StrategiesTo prevent dehydration while fasting it is important to make sure that there is enough fluid intake during the non-fasting hours. Patients should prioritize drinking water and avoid high sugar beverages. [](https://www.zoomtventertainment.com/latest-news) Latest Entertainment News End of Article

author: Patheresa Wells; Published December
title: Tay Tay Dance Party @ El CorazÃ³n - The Ticket
text: ðŸ“† Thursday, January 4th ðŸŽŸ $20 ðŸ“ El CorazÃ³n: 109 Eastlake Ave E, Seattle What Taylor Swift (and BeyoncÃ©) have done for the economy this last year with their tours might have kept us out of a recession. Thatâ€™s a cheeky thing to say, but also the Taylor Swift Impact created an economic boost on 53 nights in 20 locationsâ€”a [ five-month, five-billion-dollar shift](https://www.ustravel.org/news/taylor-swift-impact-5-months-and-5-billion). Then there was the â€œ [Swift Quake](https://www.cnn.com/2023/07/27/entertainment/taylor-swift-seismic-activity/index.html),â€ where fans triggered an earthquake in Seattle. With that kind of momentum, consider starting 2024 with the touring Tay Tay Dance party at El CorazÃ³n in Seattleâ€™s Cascade neighborhood. Join DJ Swiftie for a two-hour party â€œTaylor-madeâ€ for Swifties. Expect hits from every eraâ€”Lover, Fearless, Evermore, Reputation, Speak, Now, Red, Folklore, 1989, Midnights, and whatever else Iâ€™m forgetting. This all-ages event includes a laser show to accompany the setlist, which spans Swiftâ€™s almost 18-year career and ten studio albums. Whether a fan or hater, Swift is so damn honest you canâ€™t help having at least a little admiration. Dance tip: Try Taylorâ€™s signature dance move, [The Mom Croon](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QdaEBbqL5V4&ab_channel=TaylorSwiftVietnamFC), which is about feeling IDGAF because the beat has you caught up. Let go and succumb to the lavender haze. ðŸ’Œ Be Our Pen Pal! Find out whatâ€™s happening in Seattle by [subscribing to our newsletter](https://theticket.seattletimes.com/newsletter/).

author: EFE
title: Una ONG denuncia la muerte de 14 personas en una zÃ³diac al sur de Canarias - El PeriÃ³dico Extremadura
text: Al menos catorce personas han muerto ahogadas en una zÃ³diac cuyos ocupantes llevan pidiendo auxilio desde las 14.00 horas de este jueves desde un punto del AtlÃ¡ntico situado a unos 55 kilÃ³metros de Cabo Bojador, en la costa marroquÃ­ del SÃ¡hara Occidental, al sur de [Canarias](/tags/islas-canarias/), porque su barca se desinfla y se hunden. Es la denuncia que realiza la activista Helena Maleno, fundadora de Caminando Fronteras, ONG que lleva toda la tarde de este jueves en contacto con los nÃ¡ufragos y que ha transmitido su posiciÃ³n a las autoridades espaÃ±olas y marroquÃ­es para que movilicen medios de rescate. Por la localizaciÃ³n del incidente, ha asumido la emergencia Rabat. Maleno ha facilitado a EFE una foto enviada por los supervivientes que todavÃ­a siguen a flote, una imagen nocturna y borrosa en la que se ve a entre seis y siete personas sentadas a horcajadas sobre un flotador de una neumÃ¡tica, doblado y medio deshinchado. Y tambiÃ©n un audio que le ha remitido una de las ocupantes de la patera. En Ã©l se escucha a una mujer decir en francÃ©s: "Estamos aquÃ­, Helena. Soy una mujer embarazada de nueve meses, estoy en el flotador (de la zÃ³diac). Todos los chicos del medio (de la embarcaciÃ³n) han desaparecido, la gente estÃ¡ desapareciendo, hasta ahora no hemos visto a la Marina". "Toda la gente estÃ¡ desapareciendo. Â¡Por favor ayÃºdennos, ayÃºdennos! Â¡Estamos aquÃ­, ayÃºdennos! Estamos sentados asÃ­ en el flotador (se refiere a la imagen que adjunta con el audio). Es muy peligroso, el agua estÃ¡ entrando", se lamenta la mujer Helena Maleno ha explicado a EFE que, segÃºn la informaciÃ³n que han recabado sobre esa neumÃ¡tica, se trata de un grupo de 58 personas que salieron el miÃ©rcoles desde la costa del Sahara hacia Canarias y que ahora se encuentran al suroeste de Cabo Bojador. Entre ellos, aÃ±ade, hay siete mujeres (incluyendo a la embarazada) y dos niÃ±os. La portavoz de Caminando Fronteras denuncia que, hasta el momento, Marruecos no ha hecho llegar ayuda a los ocupantes de esa neumÃ¡tica, ni tampoco Salvamento MarÃ­timo espaÃ±ol ha intervenido. Por eso, expresa su temor a que ocurra lo mismo que el 21 de junio, cuando varias personas murieron al hundirse una zÃ³diac al sur de Gran Canaria despuÃ©s de pasar toda la noche esperando a que llegara una patrullera de Marruecos, porque la emergencia la habÃ­a asumido el Centro de CoordinaciÃ³n de Salvamento de Rabat. Y ello, a pesar de que un barco de rescate espaÃ±ol habÃ­a estado a solo una hora de distancia de navegaciÃ³n de ellos, socorriendo a otra patera, cuando ya se conocÃ­an sus coordenadas. Ese suceso dio lugar una denuncia de la FiscalÃ­a de Canarias por presunto delito de omisiÃ³n del deber de socorro contra los responsables del operativo en EspaÃ±a, denuncia que desde este verano instruye un Juzgado de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, que ha declarado secretas las actuaciones.

author: Mo Honge
title: Chinese military budget moderate increase beneficial to world
text: The moderate increase in the annual defense budget will enable the Chinese military to bring more benefits to the world, according to a military spokesman. "China sticks firmly to a peaceful development path and its military policies are defensive in nature. The Chinese military has always been a stabilizer in a turbulent world, a positive force that maintains global security, and a firm guardian of peace. As the Chinese armed forces become stronger, the international community hopes China could provide more public security services to the world," said Senior Colonel Wu Qian, spokesman for the delegation of the People's Liberation Army and the People's Armed Police Force to the second session of the 14th National People's Congress, on Saturday. "Our defense expenditure, with a moderate and steady funding increase, will allow the armed forces to better safeguard world peace, contribute more resources to international peacekeeping, maritime escort and humanitarian relief operations, and make greater contributions to the shared well-being of mankind," said Wu, who is the publicity head at the Ministry of National Defense. He noted that the Chinese government takes into consideration both of the demands of its national defense and the economic development when planning for the country's military expenditure. "Over the past several years, the government has maintained a moderate, steady increase in defense spending to protect the country's sovereignty, security and interests and to meet the needs of the ongoing military reform, and managed to boost both our defense capability and economic strength," the spokesman said. "China's defense spending is always transparent, reasonable and moderate," the spokesman said. "The country is an active participator to the United Nations' mechanism for transparency on military expenditure and has voluntarily provided data on its annual defense costs since 2008. Compared with military powers like the United States, our defense spending is much lower by every criterion ranging from its share in the GDP and overall government expenditure to the cost per capita and per service member," Wu said. "History has proved and continues to prove that China's limited investment in the military is completely for protecting its sovereignty, security and interests, and for safeguarding the world's peace and stability. Our military is always a staunch force in maintaining world peace," he said. China is facing drastic changes in global geopolitics, complex challenges in counter-separatism struggles, and more uncertainties and instabilities in its security situation. Meanwhile, the Chinese military shoulders heavy responsibilities in defending the country. The added investment will be spent on strengthening the armed forces' combat training and funding important projects to improve the integrated national strategic system and capability; speeding up the construction of a modernized logistics system and fostering research and development for major defense technologies and weapon systems; deepening the military reform and establishing a modern military management system; and improving the work and living conditions of military personnel, according to him. The central government has proposed a defense budget of 1.67 trillion yuan ($231 billion) for the 2024 fiscal year, a 7.2 percent year-on-year increase, according to a draft budget report submitted to the ongoing annual meeting of the National People's Congress, the nation's top legislature. If approved by lawmakers, the proposed expenditure will maintain single-digit growth for a ninth consecutive year since 2016, and will remain the same percentage increase like that in 2023.

author: jpost.com
title: US, France, Germany and UK call on Iran to de-escalate nuclear program - The Jerusalem Post
text:
France, Germany, Britain, and the United States on Thursday condemned an increase by Iran in the production rate of highly enriched uranium of up to 60% purity, close to the level used for nuclear weapons fuel.
In a joint statement, the allies made no mention of any consequences Iran could face for the production hike but called for its reversal and said they remained "committed to a diplomatic solution" of the feud over Tehran's nuclear program Attempting to find a solution
"The production of high-enriched uranium by Iran has no credible civilian justification," the statement said. "These decisions ... represent reckless behavior in a tense regional context."
Since the start of Israel's offensive against Gaza's ruling Hamas militants, Iran-backed proxies have increased their attacks on shipping in the Red Sea and on US troops in Iraq and Syria, sharply increasing tensions in the region.
Israel launched its operation in response to Hamas' October 7 rampage into Israel.
The UN nuclear watchdog, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), said in a report on Tuesday that Iran had reversed a months-long slowdown in the production rate of highly enriched uranium up to 60% purity. On-again, off-again talks on Iran: International Atomic Energy Agency headquarters in Vienna (credit: Leonhard Foeger/Reuters)
"We condemn this action, which adds to the unabated escalation of Iranâ€™s nuclear program," the joint statement said. Advertisement
Iran on Wednesday dismissed the IAEA report as "nothing new" and said it was running its program "according to the rules."
Tehran already has enough uranium of 60% purity, if enriched to 90%, to make three nuclear bombs, according to the IAEA's theoretical definition.
Iran has denied seeking nuclear weapons.
Britain, France and Germany remain parties to the 2015 deal designed to prevent Iran from developing nuclear weapons. Former U.S. President Donald Trump reneged on the accord in 2018, prompting Iran to gradually violate its strictures.
